boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine
boardgame.description: Trivial Pursuit: Lorraine lets you discover or rediscover the Lorraine region, in North-east France with questions in 6 categories.

boardgame.name: Pays Graylois: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
The game of the Pays Graylois is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the centers of the Pays Graylois: Val de Gray, Monts-de-Gy and Quatre Rivières...
and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities, traditions, heritage....

boardgame.name: Floating Hive and Purple Sea
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Bee-folk! Deadly hornets! The fearsome Bearken! These creatures await you in this new micro-sphere for Troika!

Floating Hive and Purple Sea is an independent production and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

boardgame.name: Jailbreak
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The suns are just dropping down over the horizon of the Scarlet Ocean and you know that in a few minutes it will be almost totally dark in the port area in large, sprawling city of Laeveni. The city is the largest in the empire of the One True God, and contains the holy seat of power. Behind you, as dusk falls, the bells chime from the tall elegant spires of Amaldi City. Amaldi is the central Holy City that resides as an almost separate state inside its own walls in the centre of Laeveni, high on the hillsides. This separate inner city is surrounded by marble walls 50 feet high, and just as thick, and nigh on impregnable. And it is guarded by 5000 warrior monks and priest knights.

boardgame.name: Hunted
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The grate lock gives, and you push it open and climb through. Then with a start you realise you are standing in a vestibule atop a tall, marble clad spire, in the centre of the Amaldi City itself. You look down over the many marble buildings and their stained glass windows. The early morning light reflects off the white stone and coloured glass so that it almost blinds you.

boardgame.name: Heroes
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Feeling uneasy, you walk towards the shimmering portal and pass through it. Time and space seem to meld into one. Then you appear in a hexagonal chamber. Everything is black but accented with silver. Black wax candles stand all around you, flickering seemingly with an arcane silver flame.

boardgame.name: Psycho Killer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

December 17th, 10:22 am
Incident number EXY99-121246706/2C

Police were called to a suburban house at 10:22am on Friday 17th December after neighbours reported a possible disturbance in the house.

boardgame.name: A ⇨ TO ⇦ B, or, The Structural Dynamics of Flow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A to B is a play-by-post game that can, theoretically, support infinite players. One player will play as a Courier, tasked with transporting one object from Point A to Point B. Everyone else will develop characters within the game who will provide some sort of obstacle to the Courier, whether they are actively trying to help or harm.
boardgame.rpg: A ⇨ TO ⇦ B, or, The Structural Dynamics of Flow

boardgame.name: Catbox
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Catbox is a GM-less tabletop game meant to evoke crime-thriller movies about people with differing agendas all stuck in the same place (Reservoir Dogs, The Hateful Eight, Hotel Artemis, Bad Times at the El Royale). Each player will play a character with a secret agenda to complete, one that may or may not place them in direct opposition to the other characters and NPCs they are trapped with.

boardgame.name: 1863: London Underground
boardgame.description:
A Victorian London setting sees players compete for financial success with numerous historical companies that can be founded, acquired, merged, and folded to represent an alternative history of the London Underground from its audacious beginnings to its eventual semi-nationalisation in 1933 under the umbrella of the London Passenger Transport Board.

1863 London Underground is railroad operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series of games, and based on the rules from the excellent 1817. The small geographic location and the addition of subsidiaries, operating costs, and the looming shadow of the LPTB are some of the main features that set it apart.

Each turn players can open new, or buy/sell shares in existing companies. These companies expand their underground network by laying track and running trains to generate revenue. This can be paid as dividends to share holders or retained to purchase new trains and cover expenses.

The end of the game occurs when either the last train is purchased or only one company remains. At this point the player with the highest personal wealth in cash and assets wins. With no luck involved, success is found through careful planning, shrewd decisions and ruthless actions.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Stick Stack: Cool Black
boardgame.description:
You don't want to be stuck with sticks in Stick Stack, so try to place them as carefully as you can on the wobbling tower in the center of the playing area.

Each turn, you either draw a stick from the bag or choose one of the sticks in front of you (in case you had collected any on an earlier turn), then you place that stick onto the tower — but when you place it, the colors on that stack can touch only matching colors on the crow's nest or on other sticks that have already been placed. (If a stick slides onto other colors later as the tower tilts and wobbles, that's okay, but you need to match when placing!)

If any sticks fall off the tower on your turn, collect them and place them in front of you. When all the sticks have been placed onto the tower or when the tower falls over, the game ends immediately. If you caused the tower to fall, you don't collect any of the sticks, but you do score five points (which isn't good). Every player scores one point for each stick in front of them.

If anyone has eleven or more points, the game ends and the player with the lowest score wins.

Stick Stack Cool Black is a new version of the origin Stick Stack game. It provides a cooler color selection and challenge cards element to enhance the game play experience.

boardgame.name: Bachelorlock
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A 2 player game about gambling with demons.

boardgame.name: It Takes A Thief
boardgame.description:
A modular 3D board game where players take on the roles of thieves to steal loot to complete objectives.
The thief with the most prestige point after a set amount of rounds wins.
Difficulty is modified by adding or subtracting "Guard" cards along with longer or shorter games via more or less rounds.
Tiles are placed on each turn, making the dwelling more accessible to the players.
Players have the option to: defeat or evade guards, and disarm or evade traps.
Inventory management by using a player board means that not every piece of loot can be taken.
Items are used to gain bonuses, or complete objectives, the players must choose wisely.

boardgame.name: Le Mans et son Pays: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
Le Mans et son Pays is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers in the department of Sarthe... and then go travel all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities....

The winner will have to be the first one to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Circuit Paul Ricard
boardgame.description:
Be the first to buy the headlights stages of Paul Ricard (curves, chicanes, etc.) as soon as you can. Build houses and hotels and collect rents up during the game. Win your opponents at auctions, negotiate with them the properties you wish to acquire.

In a word, take risks, be as smart and gagnez the game!
And for even faster parts: play dice with the new faster you move on the board, you will become the richest in record time!

The Paul Ricard Circuit is the heart of the "Destination Castelet", a unique site dedicated to recreation and tourism in the south of France, in the heart of Provence, between sea and editing. The infrastructure of the Circuit Paul Ricard, technological innovation, design and architecture today make this place a feeling of space for communication, event operations and leisure around the automobile in general.

boardgame.name: The Birth of the Stone Monkey
boardgame.description:
This picture book and game tells the story of The Birth of Stone Monkey. In Aolai Country, there is an island called Mountain of Flowers and Fruit which has a magic stone on the top of it. The stone receives the power from nature and bursts open one day to produce a stone monkey. The stone monkey leaps straight to the waterfall to explore and travel across the continents and oceans to worship Patriarch Subhut for learning skills.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: recognize three-dimensional graphics; recognize numbers; understand locations and directions; recognize time, and recognize plane figures and colors. It also includes an observance ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- The Birth of the Stone Monkey: Fill the picture that shows the scene of the Mountain
- Jump into the Cave of Water Curtains: Help the monkey jump into the cave of water curtains
- Monkey King in the Cave of the Water Curtains: Help the monkeys host the feast
- Search for Three-Stared Cave: Find Three-Stared Cave
- Pass Down the Magic in the Middle of the Night: Find out the exact time to meet Master Bodhisattva
- 72 Transfigurations: Help Wukong learn three kinds of transfigurations

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Uproar in Heaven
boardgame.description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Uproar in Heaven. Sun Wukong returned after learning and found golden cudgel while he explores the Dragon Palace, signed the book of life and death at King Yama's place, and uproar in the Heaven.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Master arithmetic within 20; Understand Spatial Transformation; Recognize shapes and locations change; Recognize plane figures and understand regularity. It also includes a reaction ability training activity.

To win 6 levels in the game:
- Treasure Hunt in Dragon Palace: Help Wukong escape the Dragon Palace.
- The book of Life and Death: Fold the book of life and death
- Uproar in Heaven: Defeat the rivals
- Casting spells in Peach Garden: Freeze the seven fairies
- Erlang Shen: Get to know the secret of 72 transfigurations
- Escape the Cauldron: Help Wukong get out of the Cauldron

After you complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game. The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Battle for Hamburger Hill
boardgame.description:
This game challenges the players to re-fight the Battle for Hamburger Hill. Can you, as the U.S. player, destroy the NVA, capture the hill and deny the enemy their base area? Or will the NVA player triumph and hold their ground? Get ready to re-live or re-write history in the battle for Hamburger Hill!

The Battle for Hamburger Hill lasts 11 turn-pair game-days (with a night turn each game-day also). Each turn, players alternate moving and attacking each other’s forces on the game map, which is divided into hexes. Combat can include small arms firefights between adjacent units or fire missions that target hexes with artillery, airstrikes, helicopter gunships and mortars.

At the end of each combat phase, once all fire combat is complete, adjacent units may conduct close quarters combat (CQC) to decide which force will occupy contested hexes. Each game-day, after all movement and combat is completed, both sides draw cards to determine special actions for the future day’s turns and may get reinforcements according to card events, history and the roll of the dice.

As the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) player, your goal is to hold hill 937 and hill 916. If, at the end of the last turn, the U.S. player does not control both of the summit hexes, you have won.

As the Allied player, your goal is to control both summit hexes at the same time. Whenever the U.S. player has accomplished this at the end of a game-day, the game ends with a U.S. victory.

boardgame.name: Tame Four Disciples
boardgame.description:
This picture book and game tells the story of Tame Four Disciples. Sun Wukong was sealed under the Five Elements Mountain for five hundred years. Tang Sanzang released Sun and they finally met. After that, Tang tamed the white horse in Eagle's Sorrow Gorge, won over Zhu Bajie in Old Gao Village, and fought with Sha Wujing at the River of Flowing Sands.

Different adventure levels combined mathematical knowledge into the game to help children enlighten thinking, master knowledge, develop good habits of independent learning and active thinking. 6 games correspond to 6 education points: Understand graphical decomposition and combination; Recognize numbers within 100; Understand the set of the numbers, and draw route map. It also includes a focus ability training activity and a logical ability training activity.

To win 6 levels of the game:
- Five Elements Mountain: Help Tang Sanzang climb to the top of the mountain
- Band-tightening spell: Recognizing numbers within 100/dynamic memory
- Tame the Bailong in the Yingchou Mountain Stream: Guess and see who is fastest and most correct
- Zhu Bajie carry his wife: Scratch off the coating and see who Bajie is really carrying
- Tame Zhu Bajie in Yunzhan Cave: Search every corner of the cave
- Tame Sha Monk in Quicksand River: Defeat the rival

After player complete each level, insert the manual card to the corresponding page in the passport comes with the game.
The first one who collects all 6 manual cards and fills the passport is the winner of the game.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Flip & Phrase
boardgame.description:
Flip & Phrase is a game that allows children to use Chinese words flexibly, make sentences by association, and makeup stories creatively. In the first half of the game, children do not need to write, so they can focus on their creation. The second half is "writing", using associative memory, writing out keywords, and recreating the scene of the story. In the game, there are 200 frequently used words from the Chinese primary school vocabulary list. The vocabulary list requires children to master the dictation of the words and be proficient in basic Chinese words. Using the form of "oral composition" and "extract keywords", the game lowered the difficulty of the composition and raise the children's learning interest in this subject. The game also makes full use of the means of "listening, speaking, reading, and writing", combined with a real-time feedback mechanism that children can fully use their imagination to break the shackles of thinking and master the skills of composition.

Game setup: Each player takes a player map and its corresponding scoreboard, a pencil, and a sheet of notepaper. Each player draws 5 word cards. Hold them in the hand and don't let other players see them

To start the game: Reverse the hourglass for timekeeping. All players have 30 seconds to prepare an impressive story with the 5 words on the card. After 30 seconds, all players place the cards face down on their map from left to right, starting with the first player and telling each player's story in a clockwise manner. To end the game: When all players have finished telling the story, invert the hourglass and wait 30 seconds, then write down the other players' words in order on a sheet of notepaper. When one player has written all the words can be remembered, place the paper in the center of the table and turn the hourglass around again. The other players have another 30 seconds to continue to recall and record words.

After all players submit their answers, the words will be revealed by the order of storytelling. Players will give their scoring marks to the player who first turned in the notepaper with all words in a correct manner. 1 point for each correct word (correct order and spelling), 2 points for each player who memorizes 5 words from your story, 2 points for each score mark earned from another player, and -2 points for the player's own score mark. The player with the highest total score wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Stack Poetry
boardgame.description:
An education board game combined with primary school level Chinese classic poetry!

This fun game of reciting ancient Chinese poems has 105 poem title cards, covering 75 ancient Chinese poems that are required to be learned in the Chinese primary schools. The question cards focus on the design of difficulty levels, from a sentence of the poem, transition to a pair of sentences of the poem, and finally the whole poem. In the game, children can gradually get the sense of achievement of reciting Chinese poetry, through the rapid response mechanism, the game fully mobilized the enthusiasm of children. Once you start the game, you just can't stop!

Game setup: Each player takes one set of pagodas, put the bell on the center of the table. Based on the difficulty level, randomly select material cards, shuffle them into a deck. There are 105 material cards in the game, they are sorted into 3 different levels: primary material cards, intermediate material cards, advanced material cards, 4 sets of pagodas (5 pagodas in each set), one bell

To start the game: Flip one material card, according to the poem, setup the pagodas by the order of color of the sentence. The first player who rings the bell wins the card. To end the game: The first player who won 12 cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Poetry Express
boardgame.description:
Come to appreciate the classic Chinese poetry!

Poetry Express contains 75 classic poems that are required to be learned in Chinese primary school. Children can read and appreciate these classic works of "painting in poetry, poetry in painting" through the form of games. In the game, children enjoy the learning experience of poetry with their endless imagination by describing the picture expressed by the poem, knowing the poem, expressing the poem, and imagining the artistic conception of the poem.

Game setup: Shuffle the cards into a deck, use the top card of the deck to form a 5*5 square matrix with the cards face up. Shuffle the question stick, put them into the container and set it at a convenient place, put the hourglass aside

To start the game: Shake the question stick container, randomly draw 2 sticks, show the 4 keywords on both sides of the display to all players. After all of the players have confirmed the keywords, the first play reverse the hourglass, all players find and take the poem cards that meet the requirements from the square mix. Players check each other's poem cards after taking the cards that meet the requirements or after the hourglass's time is over. If a player picks up a poem card that doesn't match any keywords, the player should put all the poem cards taken from this round in front of them with the frontside of the cards facing up. If the poetry cards you take meet more than 1 requirement, for each additional keyword meet the requirement, you can take an additional poetry card from the deck (with the backside facing up, without checking the frontside of the card) as a reward, put all the poems cards and reward cards in front of you with the backside of the card facing up

To end the game: The game ends when there is no more question stick to draw or cannot complete the 5*5 square matrix with the poem cards. Each backside-up poem card counts 1 point, and each two frontside-up poem cards counts -1 point. Less than two frontside-up cards will not count the score. The player with the highest total score is the winner.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Recycle!
boardgame.description:
A new day begins, the peaceful town is getting noisy. As life changes with each passing day, the town radiates vitality all the time. However, tons of garbage are ruining the environment. In order to improve the situation of this, an increasing number of waste disposal factories have been erected.

As the engineers of the factory, you are not only responsible for maintaining the daily operation of the factory, but also have to help the factory to become the top one out of all the other factories. Are you ready for the new events and the recycling work you promised?

In the game, you need to earn resources by collecting garbage, and then put the resources in the factory to be converted into Guokr coin. The event cards of each round will affect your work efficiency. Upgrading the factory level allows you to get points faster for the game. At the end of the game, the player who has the highest points will win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Richman10
boardgame.description:
The game uses turn system, initially all players have certain deposits, cash, cards. The number of steps to move is determined by casting dice. The landless property can be purchased when trampling on the enemy's property, and the toll will be paid when trampling on the enemy's property. In addition to the real estate grid, there are also bank, news, shop, magic house and other event lattices in the map, which make the game full of variables and entertainment. Reasonable use of the cards in hand can actively intervene in randomness, enhance strategy, maximize their own interests, and lay a good foundation for the final victory.
new pattern

In addition to traditional Richman play, "Richman10" adds the latest hot-fighting play. The map cancelled the small real estate grid, most of the map grid is to obtain the card grid, players through a large number of picking up and using cards, causing money damage to the enemy, bankruptcy, and ultimately win.

New team formation mode, can be arbitrary team formation, teammates can cover each other's property, can also develop strategies to set fire to one of the enemies, so that the rhythm of the game becomes faster.

The cards of Richman of all ages need to be collected in maps and bought in stores. In order to win, players need to balance money and points. "Richman10" cards are purchased directly with money and the counting system is cancelled. Compared with past dynasties, it has a faster rhythm and does not need to go through the previous depressing stage. The game is more exciting at the beginning.

In the story and biography mode, the barriers are moderately difficult, suitable for both young and old, and the plot is full of interesting, focusing on the positive energy stories of friendship and justice.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Damascus Gear: Operation Osaka
boardgame.description:
Mecha Hack'n'Slash "Damascus Gear: Operation Osaka HD Edition",
is now out on Steam with full HD graphics!
Pilot your humanoid mecha "GEAR", alongside with your dependable operator!
Will you be able to pay off your debts before the due date?

Aside from the improvement of graphic quality, the effects within the dungeons have been upgraded!
Included in the PC version are all the DLCs from the PlayStation®Vita release!
New weapon parts and high difficulty missions awaits you!
STORY
[GEAR System] - This system is revealed by the Atsuga Corporation in the mid-21st century revolutionized all technologies, allowing for the perfection of piloted humanoid robots called [GEARs].With the outbreak of the World War Four in 2050 and the loss of control of the [GEAR System] that followed, the world changed completely.
The berserk [GEARs] became know as [RAGE], and combat GEARs around the world began a total massacre of humanity.
Humanity was pushed to the brink of extinction, but a few survivors escaped underground and began analyzing the GEAR System to prepare for a counterattack. The war between humans and RAGE was exceedingly fierce, but thanks to the counter-RAGE organization [Freyja] and a certain GEAR mercenary, they steadily began recovering key locations on the surface. In 2112, over 50 years after the war began, humanity reclaimed Japan from the RAGE. 30 years later, in the [Cosmopolis] built upon Osaka, a pilot with an inherited [GEAR] and huge [debt] sets out with his Operator to become a Ranker in the Arena. It will not be a story for the history books, but simply a battle for their freedom...
SYSTEM
The goal of "Damascus Gear Operation Osaka" is to repay the hero's significant [debt] before the due date.In the [Cosmopolis], GEAR pilots fight day and night in the [Arena] for large sums of Eyn(this world's currency). The hero will participate in the Arena as a Ranker, aiming to use the prize money to repay his debt.
Once per day, the hero can choose to go on a [mission] or enter the [Arena].
In [missions], you explore dungeons to collect new parts, while you can win prize money and rank up by fighting in the [Arena].
Use [missions] to enhance your GEAR, and earn prize money in the [Arena] before the due date. If you don't make it by the due date...

ARENA
In the [Arena], you fight matched battles against other Rankers.Winning gives you Eyn and Arena Points. Obtaining Arena Points increases your rank.
These are basically 1 vs 1 fights, but there are some special battles where you fight multiple enemies, etc.

MISSION
On [missions], you explore the [Cosmopolis] dungeon that changes every time you enter, to collect parts and other items.More difficult dungeons can be slected by winning in the [Arena] and raising your rank.
When accepting a mission, each difficulty level will also assign 3 random sub-missions. Completing them before leaving will award you bonus rewards.

OUTFITTING
In [outfitting], you can make changes to and customize your GEAR. GEARs have 8 components: head, body, arms, legs, shoulders, right weapon, left weapon, and back weapon. You can equip parts with various different traits to these sections.You can also change the color of each section.
When you progress the story, you will also unlock Electro-Enhancement procedures to enhance the player himself.

DATA
[Data] contains the Damascus Gear timeline, glossary of terms, explanations of parts and traits, and more.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Extra Players Upgrade Set
boardgame.description:
Ever wanted to go zombie hunting with the largest posse in the west? The Extra Players Upgrade Set allows you to expand your Zombicide games to up to 12 players at once! It contains:

6 Plastic Survivor Dashboards
6 Counter Bases in new colors
48 Plastic Pegs in new colors
6 Starting Equipment cards

-description from Kickstarter campaign

boardgame.name: Sneaker War
boardgame.description:
The most desired (limited edition) sneakers are launching soon! Gather your friends to queue up and buy the sneakers! Suit up, warriors. This is War and get as many shoe boxes as possible!

Players are scalpers and play with cards. Players who collect shoeboxes with 20 points will win the game.

There are sneakers cards, queuer cards and action cards. Sneaker card shows the condition to get scores, i.e. the queuer card limit and also the points which can be taken. Queuer cards and action cards are for your hand management.

Random players begin to play clockwise and each player will choose one colour of queuer cards and action cards. They will be divided into 2 card decks. Each player draw 2 queuer cards and 2 action cards.

During your turn, player can play the queuer card concealed and below the sneaker card. If there are already queuer cards present, put below the last queuer card and queue up. Player may also choose to use action cards to fight against others, to increase own queuer numbers or create chaos. Once the queue vacancy of particular sneaker is full, reveal all queuer cards in this row and check the total queuers of each colour. Player can get points in form of shoeboxes and stack them up (There are 72 mini shoeboxes figure). Any player who collects shoeboxes with 20 points will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ESTR: Le jeu d'escarmouche
SSTR: Tabletop Miniature Skirmish Game
boardgame.description:
It's a french skirmish rules system. Players will have limited actions points to activate miniatures. Players will gain points with frags and objectives. 18 heroes who can be combined with 18 powers. 5 vs 5 combats. Fresh and unique system, streamlined rules but deep strategy. You can play with miniatures you want.

Bienvenue dans ESTR, un livre de règles pour figurines afin de revivre les escarmouches qui enchantent le public de cette fin de millénaire. En équipe de cinq contre cinq, les belligérants vont s’affronter dans des arènes de soixante centimètres sur soixante. Créez un décor selon vos envies. Les parties de ESTR peuvent se dérouler tant en décors urbains que naturels, les lieux et les races des guerriers sont aussi variés que les planètes de notre galaxie.Le jeu n’a pas de figurines imposées, jouez avec n’importe quelle marque et de n’importe quel type. Les règles d’ESTR sont originales et astucieuses à plus d’un titre. Les personnages qui meurent reviennent le tour suivant grâce aux avancées scientifiques, le jeu se déroule en activation alternée. Un système original, inédit et juste vous contraindra à un nombre limité d’activations. Usez de vos jetons d’aptitude avec parcimonie, ils sont aussi puissant que précieux. Ce ne sont que quelques exemples de toutes les particularités d’ESTR que vous trouverez dans ce livre. Jamais un jeu n’a été aussi tactique. Les règles sont fluides et claires, elles ont été pensées pour un jeu stimulant et nerveux sans complexité inutile. A vous de jouer.

boardgame.name: Manhattan
boardgame.description:
Manhattan is a unification game that always ends with one player (the winner) gathering all their pieces in one group.

Rules:
The game is played on a 6x6 square board covered in a checkered pattern of pieces of two colors, except the the 4 central squares are empty. On your turn you have two options: Move or remove. If you cannot do either you automatically pass. (One player will always have a move.)

• Move:
With one of your pieces that is not part of a group, take the first orthogonal step of the shortest possible walk along a clear path that leads to a friendly piece. That is: Of all clear paths to all friendly pieces, you must choose the one that consists of the smallest number of orthogonal steps, and reduce it by 1 orthogonal step.

• Remove:
Remove one of your pieces that belong in a group of same-colored pieces. You may not make a removal that will split the group the removed piece was part of.

boardgame.name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – reDrewno Insert
Twilight Imperium: Świt Nowej Ery – reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition with expansions: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Prophecy of Kings.

Note: External dimensions of the insert: 42.6 x 28.5 x 13.0 cm
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Prophecy of Kings

boardgame.name: Key Enigma: The Butterfly Curse
boardgame.description:
The Butterfly Curse is an original horror escape game that mixes physical and digital puzzles with dark narrative to immerse you in a such terrifying experience that it may be impossible for you to distinguish reality from fiction.

A mysterious envelope will reach your hands. Inside, you will find the material that serves as a bridge to connect the physical and digital world. By interacting with it, you must solve the enigmas and puzzles to survive to this evil curse. Your ingenuity and courage will be your only ally.

The envelope is the heart of the project and the online support material its soul. With this combination, you and your friends can face the multiple challenges with at least 2 hours of fun and puzzle-solving. It will be necessary to have a device with a good internet connection.

PLOT

The legend tells that certain people who are blessed with the gift of deciphering and solving the most complex puzzles descend from dark pacts of blood. But now, an evil curse hangs over their shoulders, one that is taking the life of more than a hundred people.

boardgame.name: Doppelt oder nichts
boardgame.description:
In this game, at least four players try to get rid of their hand cards by discarding either the matching color, number or symbol on the discard pile. But since everyone wants to win, there is of course the possibility of repeatedly putting a spoke in your fellow player's wheel. Action cards can be used to attack them and prevent someone else from playing their last card first.

Up to this point, the principle sounds familiar to many, but in "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS" (German for "DOUBLE OR NOTHING"), some things work a little differently: For example, it is possible to defend yourself by deflecting the attack on a fellow player, who in turn has the same option to defend himself. In this way, it can hit anyone and you can never be sure to reach the goal without being disturbed.

Constant action is therefore the order of the day and does not end with the cards. Those who are willing to take risks can, sometimes under full physical effort, gain an advantage in this card game. Through interactive, cognitive or coordinated tasks it is possible to prevent the drawing of penalty cards. However, one should then think twice, because whoever fails the task receives double the penalty. The deal is: "DOPPELT ODER NICHTS".

boardgame.name: Nassau Pioneer
boardgame.description:
Nassau Pioneer is a trick-taking game. During the game Player will deal with PirateTeam, collect goods, control the market. The game can be played with only 54 cards.

At the beginning of a new round, Players without any card in their hand, the game will be over. All Players show their IDcards and calculate the score, the player with the most VP will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Dark Lord: Lords and Minions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Dark Lord, you play as the Big Bad Evil Guy, leading your minions into battle against the forces of light, and stopping at nothing to conquer the world! Contained herein are the rules for generating your dark lord and their nefarious minions, everything a player needs to get started!

Players in Dark Lord each play an evil overlord as part of a dark council, but only one player controls their overlord at a time. When you are the dark lord, the other players at the table take the role of your minions. When you are a minion, you must balance boldness and cowardice to maximize your plunder in order to receive mana rewards that you can spend when playing your dark lord. The forces of light are arrayed against you and your dark council, but with enough cunning and tenacity, your reign of terror will be eternal.

Each season begins with a meeting of the dark council, when the dark lords discuss who shall embark upon what adventures. Some adventures will involve sacking towns and villages for their treasure, while others will involve scattering the gathering armies of light before they can strike at your holdings. There’s not as much plunder in driving back the heroes, but someone has to do it or it’s game over for everyone. You can strike a deal with your fellow overlords to fight the heroes in exchange for a cut of the market pillage, but can you trust them to keep their word?

When the planning is done, it’s time to march, each dark lord taking their forces in a different direction. When you head off to fight the heroes, the other players take on the role of your minions. Each of them rolls dice and finds out which minion classes from your unique list they can play. When you take the role of the Lich King of the crypts, your friends roll the dice, hoping to become a powerful ghoul assassin or vampire blood mage rather than lowly skeleton infantry. Your minions want the rewards that come from earning your favor, but they also want to live long enough to reap those rewards, they're probably not above knocking off their fellow minions in order to pull ahead in the competition for your favor, and most of them have secret agendas ranging from the inconvenient to the outright treasonous. Stay canny, and you might be able to herd these bloodthirsty cats towards the heroes long enough to sack their defenses and take their treasure.

When you return to your domain, bags bursting with treasure, you'll take it in turns with other dark lords to spend your ill-gotten gains on investing in your dark domain, building fortifications, establishing markets, and raising armies. Perhaps you want to establish occult academies and make your domain a stronghold of dark academia, or maybe you're hoping to build a mighty colosseum and host terrible blood sport in your name. Maybe you keep your peasants in line with an authoritarian police state, or perhaps you use a dark cult honoring you as god-king to inspire fanatical loyalty. Whatever your goal, you will need conquered territories to use as labor force, wealth to buy from the markets, and mana to conduct mighty rituals.

Be sure to keep an eye on your fellow dark lords as you do, as all of you buy from the same market and suck mana from the same leylines - if they buy something you had your eye on, you'll have to wait for the next season before it's replaced, and if too many other dark lords are casting rituals, you'll have to wait until the background ether quiets down a bit, or just pay a stupendous amount of mana to muscle through anyway. If your goals as dark lord are unrelated, you can probably strike a deal to manage who buys what from the market and who casts rituals when, but unfortunately most dark lords tend to gravitate towards trying to maximize their magnificence, a measure of the decadent power of their realm, and that tends to put the dark council into competition with one another for resources. Just sacked a valuable territory? Better make sure you've got troops to invade with immediately, or one of your "allies" might use ritual magic to conjure up an army to invade, land borders be damned.

When it comes time for someone else to play a dark lord, you will take on the role of a minion. Your goal when playing a minion is to amass a bounty of mana that you can spend when playing your dark lord, usually to build up your dark domain. There are two ways to go about this. The first is to win the favor of your dark lord. Each adventure, the dark lord has favor to distribute amongst the minions, and receiving more favor as a minion means having more mana as a dark lord. If you've rolled up a powerful minion, you can try to reap the rewards of winning your overlord's favor by destroying their enemies.

If you've rolled up a weakling, you could try suicide rushing the first dangerous looking knight or wizard you see, hope to get blown up, and maybe reroll something better, but there's an alternative, the second option for accumulating mana as a minion: Weak minions come with high retirement awards, especially if they survive multiple adventures. The weaker your minion class and the higher your level, the bigger your mana reward for choosing to retire the minion at the end of an adventure, instead of leveling them up. Maybe if you cower behind your stronger party members for an adventure or two, you could get yourself a lucrative payout from a terrible stat line. When you roll a new minion, you also roll up a secret objective that pays out a bit of extra mana if you complete it and then retire (but not if you complete it and then die!). Be careful, though, some of the secret objectives are things your fellow minions and/or dark lord might frown upon, and being frowned upon can have fatal consequences in the forces of evil...

boardgame.name: Dark Lord: Game Master's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Dark Lord, you play as the Big Bad Evil Guy, leading your minions into battle against the forces of light, and stopping at nothing to conquer the world! Contained herein are the rules for generating your dark lord and their nefarious minions, everything a player needs to get started!

The first is to win the favor of your dark lord. Each adventure, the dark lord has favor to distribute amongst the minions, and receiving more favor as a minion means having more mana as a dark lord. If you've rolled up a powerful minion, you can try to reap the rewards of winning your overlord's favor by destroying their enemies.

The weaker your minion class and the higher your level, the bigger your mana reward for choosing to retire the minion at the end of an adventure, instead of leveling them up. Maybe if you cower behind your stronger party members for an adventure or two, you could get yourself a lucrative payout from a terrible stat line. When you roll a new minion, you also roll up a secret objective that pays out a bit of extra mana if you complete it and then retire (but not if you complete it and then die!). Be careful, though, some of the secret objectives are things your fellow minions and/or dark lord might frown upon, and being frowned upon can have fatal consequences in the forces of evil...

boardgame.name: Dark Lord: The Complete Council
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete your Dark Council with the six sinister dark lords contained within these pages! Lead the horned hordes of the Beast Lord, master the subtle poisons of the Dark Elf Matriarch, embrace the bizarre power of the Elder Brain, become one with the swarm of the Hive Queen, mesmerize your foes as the cunning Naga Empress, or drag them down into the primordial depths as the Sahuagin High Priestess!

Note: This is an expansion book, Dark Lord: Lords and Minions is required to play. All six of these new dark lords are in Dark Lord: Ultimate - if you already have that book, you don't need this one.

boardgame.name: Radiant and Righteous
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This spheres apocrypha contains over 10 new feats to expand the power of the Guardian sphere and other options for characters who specialize in protecting those around them.

Use Desperate Focus to become even more deadly when on the verge of death. Use Harnessed Virtue to turn an imbued strike into a more deadly aligned strike. Or, build onto I Will Hear and I Will Come with the culimation feat I Will Save You.

Go beyond with Spheres Apocrypha!

boardgame.name: Monsters of Aquilae Volume 1 (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters of Aquilae is an enormous bestiary consisting of more than 200 brand-new monsters.

Each of these monsters is designed you can use immediately in any campaign setting and any plot or story.

Each monster features all of the following:

4 complete statblocks
Physical description
Encounter behavior
Story hooks & quest snippets for introducing the monster into your game
Actions and Special Qualities
Environmental description
Lore: Commonly-known information about the monster, as well as Expanded Lore, only available to a PC who passes Knowledge or related checks to uncover the info
Although presented in Pathfinder rules format, she may serve as ample inspiration for P2E, 5E, or any fantasy rules system.

boardgame.name: Phantasmagoria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a supplement for Warlock!, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by the early days of British tabletop gaming.

I, Dolkepper the master magician, have collected here what the manticore Strix told me of the creatures of the Kingdom. Some of these beings I know exist, some I have never heard of, and some I fear the beast created for my amusement and to ensure the Rebeck brandy kept flowing. I leave it to you, reader, to discern the truth and identify real monsters from fictions dreamt up by my strange companion.
In this book you will find over fifty creatures that may or may not exist in your game of Warlock, from aerial hunters to wyrms...

boardgame.name: College of Precision
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“If you can’t hit the target, don’t take the shot.”
-Haarazataka Che’To, Founder of the College of Precision

Full of RP Ideas & Feats that help your bard hit their mark!

Bonus Item: Haarazataka’s Gaze, Magical Dagger

boardgame.name: Al Abordaje
boardgame.description:
Preparation:
Each player receives a ship and the 15 balls of one color, which he places in the hold of his own ship.

Roll of the dice:
In turn, the players roll the two dice and advance three balls at the same time through the game circuit as many squares as there are points on the dice. If a star comes out on the roll of the dice, the three balls are advanced as many squares as the other dice indicates, and if the two stars come out, the Discomatic mechanism moves in the direction indicated by the arrow.

Game system:
On each game turn, after the dice are rolled, each player must advance three balls consecutively placed on the board: if the ball located in advance is advanced, the two balls immediately behind must also advance; if you want to advance a ball located in between the heading ball and your boat hold, you must advance those located at its same point of advance or immediately behind it; if you want to play a ball that has not yet entered play, you must advance two others that are still in your own boat (in your side of the board).

The balls, which can only circulate in one direction: towards the opposing boat, can go ahead passing one over the other (even if they are from opposing sides).

In each square there can only be one ball, and if it falls on the square occupied by an opposing ball, it is taken prisoner and placed in the hold of the own ship. This rule also applies to orange squares.

Prisoner rescue:
When, with an exact roll of the dice, with no remaining points, a ball manages to reach an orange square on the opposing ship, it frees as many prisoners as there are points indicated by the immediate roll of a die. If a star appears, the roll is repeated. The ball that has reached the opposing boat is removed from play.

End of game:
The first player who manages to get six balls to the opposing boat wins.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Crawl! Basics
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon Crawl Basics is a zine formatted quickstarter for DCC RPG. It includes everything you need to create 0-level characters for your first funnel adventure (except the dice). This beginners handbook is designed to be printed out as "booklet" and includes character sheets for 0-level characters conveniently on the front and back covers. Permission to print out copies for each player is encouraged.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Goblin Mutants
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Most of the people who live in the wastelands share the following four characteristics:

they consider themselves to be goblins;
others see them as goblins and deal with them however they think goblins should be dealt with;
they have one or more unique (or at least rare) mutant features that distinguish them from others;
and they don’t belong to a powerful political faction, like the orcs and Moon Goblins do.


But instead of constituting a cultural or social majority, these goblin mutants are more like a collection of numerous minority factions — guilds, gangs, and warlords, wealthy mutarchs and their mercenary bands, sorcerous cults and covens, active smuggling networks, and even isolationist settlements. Many of these groups operate out of The Quarry, where the business of stone dominates everything, but none have as much power as The Eyrie or The Furnace.

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Multiverse
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

Merchants of Multiverse is a 32 page, saddle stitched, B&W, 5.5” x 8.5” zine for Mutant Crawl Classics and other OSR-style systems. It can be used to make your post-apocalyptic or interstellar game feel more alive and active. It contains the following:

- Over 50 new artifacts of the ancients!
- Rules for buying and selling artifacts
- 7 colorful merchants from around the multiverse!
- A brand new MCC adventure!
- Amazing and original art from Boson Au!
- Tables for trading and travel
- Tips for MCC-ifying those DCC modules
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: RPGPundit Presents (Issue 104)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 104 (February 25, 2021): More Medieval-Authentic Secret Societies

Six secret societies are presented for Medieval-Authentic OSR settings, including Dark Albion with the Lion & Dragon RPG. While very little historical evidence exists of true secret societies during the Medieval Period (as opposed to cults, heresies, and public religious movements), there is no reason why they could not have existed.This issue explores more likely societies to come from this era, along with their rituals and responsibilities.

boardgame.name: Brains!: Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
12 Promotional card for Brains (including the cover card)

Released alongside Kickstarter base game but packaged separately from it.

boardgame.name: The Bloody Affair
boardgame.description:
From the product description:

The Bloody Affair takes place every year in Castle Hemoglobin and sees vampires from all spheres gather to celebrate their cursed condition and share new hypnosis tricks. You've managed to be invited (probably a mistake), or maybe you were captured for your delicious blood (definitely not a mistake) and now you have to escape the party! Or stay and enjoy the company, who knows what you might find out...

This pocket sphere for TROIKA! contains vampires to meet, rooms to explore, items to find and gaieties to participate in or watch from a safe distance!

boardgame.name: Tenacious Helmets
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Old battlefields are not a hard thing to come by in the Dying World. Filled with rotting bodies and abandoned weapons, they are monuments to the violence of men and poorly planned battles. But some warriors' thirst for blood shall be quenched even in death! These comeback from the afterlife to possess their once trusted helmet and start seeking a sturdy body to control and take to a fight!

The Tenacious Helmets is a monster based on unfinished business, misplaced trust and faulty armour.

boardgame.name: Culture Shock: The Black British History Quiz Game
boardgame.description:
Culture Shock is a fun and educational quiz card game that inspires learning about the history of Black people in Britain spanning over a hundred years.

With 52 question cards, players will test their knowledge on key figures in British history, key dates and events. Question topics range from sports to politics, music to activism.

Players can participate in teams or face off individually. Each question card is worth points. The player or team with the most points wins.

Culture Shock is the ideal game to play on a games night, while traveling or in a classroom.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Bajs Memory
Bajsmemo
boardgame.description:
Young children love talking about poop. This game is about learning about different animals' poop.

Look at the picture of the poop, connect it with the right animal and then find the matching pictures.

An educational game that's way too much fun!

--description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dread Tower
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Enter the Dread Tower, a gate to the underground fortress of Bhaligund, one of Skandir's most treacherous sons. Fight deadly creatures or be clever and try to run away from them. Find secret passages, remove traps, solve puzzles, and overcome obstacles that will challenge your players' skills.

boardgame.name: Calabachas y Dragones
Donions and Dragons
boardgame.description:
It's two board games in one!

It is a board game inspired by role-playing games with two game modes, Adventures and Battle.

In the adventure mode the players' decisions will be more relevant to the challenges that the Dungeon Master puts in front of them. It is a classic RPG adventure without rules or complicated formulas, perfect to play with the little ones of the house or to get started in the world of role-playing games.

In the Battle mode players will have to defeat the enemies of an imaginary dungeon using their fighting dice. It combines strategy, chance, social decisions and companionship. Perfect for an easy to start game with your friends.

boardgame.name: Bobo: Hoera ik ben 4
boardgame.description: Bobo celebrates his 4th birthday. Now he can go to school. In the box are four games: getallen memory (number memory), Bobo's wijzerspel (Bobo's spin the wheel game), Bobolino and kleuren-dobbelspel (color dice game).

boardgame.name: Trees are People too
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Lincoln, ME. This small, struggling town has seen better days, but life went on as usual at the shores of Mattanawcook Pond. That is, until some reports of loggers finding human limbs inside trees, and the rumors started going. News of this has reached the Omphalos, and it looks like someone has to go all the way there and find what is going on…

Trees are People Too is a scenario for the solo, modern-day occult RPG Seekers Beyond the Shroud. In it you will find:

A branching, investigative story, that would take you to different locales in Lincoln, ME, where you will meet an interesting array of characters while you try to find out what is going on.
In a race against time, you will have to make tough choices that will change the outcome of the story. With four potential endings, your decisions really do matter!
New items and a new spell for your character to obtain (if you make the right choices!).

boardgame.name: Death Dome 3,000: Battle on the Waspworth Plateau
boardgame.description:
Death Dome is an action strategy game where you control a team of four units inside the Death Dome battleground. The objective of each match is to use your team to capture as many control points and gather as many credits as possible. Between matches, you must equip your team with the best equipment that you can afford.

Play a quick match or a whole campaign series. Try different combinations of characters and equipment. Capture control points, collect beetle shells for defeating enemy units, and free your teammates from jail if they are captured.

Players start with 4 units in a base and get to move 2 units each turn. The match lasts for 6 turns. Each unit phase a unit can move and do 1 action, usually either capture a control point or attack an enemy unit. Players get points for each captured control point or defeated enemy at the end of the match. The player with the most points wins. Points turn into credits and can be used to buy new equipment for the next match. Players can compete in a series of matches.

Players draw cards each turn, with bonus cards for each 5 control points they control. Cards can be used to attack or defend or other abilities. Cards are only redrawn at the start of each turn so players must decide how to manage their hand of attacks and save some for defense.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Virtue Signal: Deplorables
boardgame.description:
The Deplorables expansion adds over a hundred new cards to the game, and allows you (finally) to grief other players as a disgusting internet troll.

Deplorables is a game within a game. The deplorable players use a separate deck all their own, with unique cards, game mechanics and objectives. You thought it was wild before, hoo boy.

Requires Virtue Signal: The Game to play.

⚠ACHTUNG!⚠ Deplorables is Probably not for kids and definitely not for the thin-skinned. While it doesn't actually portray anything explicit, it makes reference to things that are absolutely disgusting.

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Virtue Signal: the Game of Social Justice

boardgame.name: Virtue Signal: Celebrity NPC Pack
boardgame.description:
16 additional NPCs that look like people you might recognize. Or you might not.

Requires Virtue Signal base game to play.

Includes: Goolagle, Commie Barney Sanderson, Jill-ette, the Skeeze, Sonichu Fan, Ayahuasca Joe, The Best Card in the Universe, The Enigmatic Madam Wu, Fashbook, Definitely Not the CIA, Guðbjorg Þunberp, The Hunger that Dooms Worlds, Dropkicker, American Pravda, Sportzball, and Jenk.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Virtue Signal: the Game of Social Justice

boardgame.name: Drakar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The earth is gone

The gods are real

We must find Valhalla

The runes guide us

Drakar is a sci-fi, indie microRPG inspired by the climate crisis, Norse iconography, and episodic science fiction television such as Star Trek: The Next Generation and The Expanse.

The aim of the game is to pilot your ship, the Drakar, to a new homeland named Valhalla. The earth has been made uninhabitable by global warming, and the various human factions have made a break for the stars in the hope of finding new planets suitable for habitation. You belong to NORSE, the Nordic Office for Research into Space Exploration. No one can say how long the journey will take, but you have placed your faith in the Old Gods to guide you.

Drakar is a classless microRPG which uses a d6 to determine character skills (Power and Prowess) and ship scores (Bridge, Hull, and Systems). After character and ship creation, Drakar uses dominoes to determine which troubles characters face on their journey to Valhalla, and whether their actions to overcome the troubles are successful. It can be played as a solo game, a one-player-one-GM game, or with a group of 2 to 5 players.

boardgame.name: Untitled Synchrony Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The two of you are united against a common foe. together, describe your opponent: a gargantuan beast, a spaceship empire, a carceral police state, a gentrifying developer, or anything else. be as abstract or as tangible as you want.

boardgame.name: Unlocked Troubles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The earth is gone

The gods are real

We must find Valhalla

The runes guide us

Drakar is a sci-fi, indie microRPG inspired by the climate crisis, Norse iconography, and episodic science fiction television such as Star Trek: The Next Generation and The Expanse.

The aim of the game is to pilot your ship, the Drakar, to a new homeland named Valhalla. The earth has been made uninhabitable by global warming, and the various human factions have made a break for the stars in the hope of finding new planets suitable for habitation. You belong to NORSE, the Nordic Office for Research into Space Exploration. No one can say how long the journey will take, but you have placed your faith in the Old Gods to guide you.

Unlocked Troubles is the first official expansion to the Drakar core game, featuring 41 new Troubles to accompany those presented in the original game. These new troubles come from the game's author, JVC Parry, as well as Alison Huang, Dan Hunt, Cat Evans, Jacky Leung, Leon Barillaro, Matt Sanders, Oliver Darkshire, Sadie Lowry, Stephen Hart, and Tom Wilkins.

boardgame.name: Alone with the Killer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Maybe you were having a party at your friend Stu’s house, or getting the old campgrounds ready for a new wave of campers. Maybe you were vacationing at a cabin in the woods, or babysitting on Halloween. Whatever you w ere doing when you and your friends were attacked doesn’t matter anymore. Nothing matters anymore, because your friends are dead, and someone - or something - is hunting you down.

boardgame.name: Alone with the F***ed Up Guy Looking at You
Alone with the Fucked Up Guy Looking at You
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’re starting to get tired of this shit.

Every couple days, there’s a fucked up guy who comes rocking up out of the shadows to fuck with you. They might be just a masked dude climbing in through your window while you’re asleep, a tall, faceless asshole who stands in the woods, or some feral naked thing that squats in your shed and probably wants to eat you. They could do any kind of weird crap to you - glitch your electronics, make you cough up blood, change the geometry of your house, or just stand there silently and scare the shit out of you. You’d think this kind of shit only went on at night, but they could show up pretty much whenever, wherever.
boardgame.rpg: Alone with the F***ed Up Guy Looking at You

boardgame.name: At Least it was Here
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You'll create a study group together, then draw cards from a deck to formulate episodes, discuss plot beats, and figure out what surreal misadventures the group stumbles into along the road to finals.

boardgame.name: Calling Card
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Calling Card is a business card trading game for players who want to pretend to be very important demons doing favors for each other or dramatically challenging one another to duels.

boardgame.name: Slay the Sacred Beast
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Slay the Sacred Beast is a game where you and your friends play as a hunting party of knights, sent into the forest around the kingdom to find and slay the Beast that lives there. All outcomes in the game are determined by shooting a Nerf gun (or other soft projectile) at a target attached to a wall.

boardgame.name: Pick of Destiny
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You and your BAND have come into the possession of the legendary PICK OF DESTINY, a magical item said to be made from the tooth of SATAN HIMSELF and imbued with the POWER OF ROCK. If you hope to keep it, you must battle the SEVEN LORDS OF HELL in a series of sick ROCK-OFFS.

boardgame.name: Most Dangerous Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Most Dangerous Game is an asymmetrical LARP/Nerf tag game where you have 15 minutes to survive as either a party of HUNTERS, or the sole HUNTED who is their quarry. It is best played outdoors at night in warm weather, or in a large, dark house with minimal obstacles.

boardgame.name: Man is the Warmest Place to Hide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A micro-LARP for 5+ people based on John Carpenter's 1982 movie The Thing. It's a short-ish party game about assimilating, distrusting, and ultimately murdering your friends and coworkers to try and prevent the spread of an unknowable alien creature.
boardgame.rpg: Man is the Warmest Place to Be

boardgame.name: Galaxy Hunters: Stretch Goal Box
boardgame.description: All stretch goals from Kickstarter (KS exclusives), including 4 news Mechas (Starfire, Maximus, Black Wasp and Lightning Angel), 4 new pilots (Maya G.A., Mina Nodtrian, Kan Utara, Vash Nightow), Corporations systems, along with new Mechas equipment upgrades and creatures to battle.

boardgame.name: CLUTCH: The Egg RPG, Lair of the Frying Pan
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You’re an egg: the symbol of rebirth or a tasty snack. You roll with a clutch of other eggs. You have 1 hit point.

Game requires pencils or pens, and 4d6 for each player, preferably each pair of those dice a different color. You can play the game solo or up to a full dozen.
boardgame.rpg: CLUTCH: The Egg RPG, Lair of the Frying Pan

boardgame.name: Spindlewheel
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Spindlewheel is an interpretive tarot-like storytelling game where you use the concepts in the cards as anchors to weave together a story with your friends! Spindlewheel is a loom on which you weave stories, placing cards like threads to intertwine and complicate the tale. It’s also genre-agnostic: whether a spread of cards describes the fate of a kingdom or a bizarre encounter at a bus stop, is up to you!

boardgame.name: Galaxy Hunters: New Ways to Hunt
boardgame.description:
Expand your arsenal and abilities with the New Ways to Hunt Expansion. Choose from several new mechanics to enhance your experience:

Push your luck and take on the mightiest of mutants with Combat Dice. Obliterate your target with critical hits, or miss wildly in your vain attempt at glory.
Hunt with up to five players.
Outsmart your fellow mercenaries and disperse Ambassadors throughout the system, gaining resources on their move.
The Iron Smoker mech, and new Pilot Duar Krill Join in the hunt, ready to spread notoriety, throughout the system.


Choose any of these mechanics at the start of each game. Outwit, outmanoeuvre, and annihilate your foes with News Ways to Hunt.

listing.notes: Shipping via USPS Flat Rate, UPS, or Local Pick up in store (343 S. Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211) We are an online AND brick and mortar game shop located in the Los Angeles Area. The store is a labor of love between friends and brought to you by avid gamers. We TRULY appreciate your business! - Blue Gnome Games
Title: Galaxy Hunters: New Ways to Hunt Publisher: IDW Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Death Charades
boardgame.description:
Death Charades is a party game that pokes fun at life’s inevitable demise. In timed rounds players draw cards and wordlessly act out the multitude of ways one might meet their maker, seeing how many cards their team can guess before time runs out. If you can play charades you can play Death Charades: Make teams, act out the cards in timed rounds, keep score, don’t actually die. Death Charades is the game where death is the life of the party! We're all going to die someday, so why not have fun while we're all still alive?

Players will split into two teams as evenly as possible. In timed rounds, each player takes 45 seconds drawing one card at a time acting out a cause of death, trying to get their team to guess what is written on the card. No words allowed, and teams alternate until each team member has acted one or two rounds. At the end of two rounds whoever has the most cards guessed correctly wins!

Each copy of Death Charades comes with the game box, 205 death cards, 10 gameplay cards and 4 blanks to write your own deaths.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Xbox Series X
boardgame.description: console

boardgame.name: Spindle Phone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spindle Phone is a supplementary deck [...] consisting of 40 cards named after and based on the songs of Lemon Demon. This deck focuses on adding a surreal, paranormal aesthetic to your storytelling experience, including cards about aliens, cryptids, bad financial decisions, seasonal affective disorder, amnesia, Adrian Brody, and renegade sharks who hate cops.

boardgame.name: Apache Class Scout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you absolutely need to find out what your enemies are doing, but they really don’t want you to know, you need an Apache Scout. If you need to insert or extract your special forces team, use an Apache. When you need to get materials through hostile space, an Apache is a good choice. They are fast and tough, they can get in close enough to get an in-depth sensor reading and bring the data, commandos or equipment back.

The ship is designed according to the Cepheus Engine rules for compatibility with 2D6 science fiction Role playing games. The files include details of the air, power, water and hydrogen systems, exterior stowage and a notes on different models. You can incorporate this ship into a range of settings, although it’s best suited to military or spying roles.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Storming: La Casa Stregata
boardgame.description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

Strange killings are verifying in the city of George Town, a policeman and a nurse go to investigate in a strange house that seems to be linked with the apparitions of beast-men.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the house and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues, runes and keys that open the way to the final boss (Abor-Kandra), and succeeds in defeating him.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Storming: Orrore a Innsmouth
boardgame.description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

The citizen of Newburyport are missing from their houses, therefore an archaeologist and a psychoanalyst go to investigate in the near village of Innsmouth, finding it inhabited by fish-man hybrids.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the map and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues and keys that open the way to the final boss (Dagon), and succeeds in defeating him.

boardgame.name: Fatum: Character Creator Deck
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Quick and random character story creation!

Fatum is a powerful yet easy tool designed to create full-fledged stories for your fantasy RPG characters. Although built with fantastic/epic roleplaying game systems in mind, it's been developed to fuel other artistic creations, whether you're a writer, a screenwriter, or an illustrator.

boardgame.name: Heroic Challenges Core Set
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Heroic Challenges cards encourage immersive roleplaying and teamwork. Add an exciting new dimension to your game, either in the players' hands or as a game master tool.

Box Contains:

50 durable challenge cards
50 durable rewards cards
Hundreds of possible choices
For any fantasy tabletop roleplaying game

boardgame.name: Heroic Challenges Powers & Prowess
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Elevate your roleplaying!
Heroic Challenges cards encourage immersive roleplaying and teamwork. Add an exciting new dimension to your game, either in the players' hands or as a game master tool.

Box Contains:

25 rewards cards
