boardgame.description: Martial Arts

boardgame.name: Five Nights at Freddy's: Security Breach
boardgame.description: Horror

boardgame.name: GURPS Magical Styles: Horror Magic
boardgame.description:
Magic Man Was Not Meant To Know

Despite its "set piece" sorcery and limited flexibility, the main magic system in the GURPS Basic Set and GURPS Magic offers a major advantage: Effects are spelled out clearly ahead of time, meaning no spell-creation mini-game and relatively few arguments at the gaming table. This degree of predictability is great for games with fireballs and dragons, like hack 'n' slash fantasy, but not suited to every genre that features the supernatural.

GURPS Magical Styles: Horror Magic uses the tools of GURPS Thaumatology: Magical Styles to adapt this system to genres where magic is supposed to be a secret – likely a creepy one, if not evil. Cult Secrets is a style for secretive wizards who don robes to carry out ceremonies under cover of darkness, usually in the name of a demon or dark god. The Dark Path, on the other hand, is followed by loners who delve into forbidden books to show their detractors the price of laughing at their ambitions. And Forgotten Wisdom suits traditionalists whose problem is largely one of image . . . but who aren't above cursing enemies.

Ultimately, it isn't about the spells you cast but who you damn to Hell when you cast them – which could be you, if you aren't very, very careful!

-Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Mosquito Family
boardgame.description:
Mosquito Family is about assaulting unsuspecting people and pets with your mosquitoes to collect blood and increase popularity among mosquitoes.
But be careful, otherwise your mosquitoes will have to escape!

Object of the game:
Have the most blood at the end of the game.

Player Turn:
At each turn these steps must be performed:
1. Day or night
If you are the first to take a turn, in this round, turn the Day/Night card over.
2. Assault a target
Choose an available Target card that has the Blood face visible and draw Blood cards to assault a target. In case you draw a Look card, or you exceed tolerance limit of the target (based on the visible face of Day/Night card), stop immediately and the Angry face step begins. In the Angry face step, flip Event cards and try to run away!
3. Coming home
Place live Mosquito Tokens that have assaulted a target on the Player Card Blood Track, at the value equal to the amount of blood collected. You can place Mosquito Tokens over the others. Those Mosquito Tokens remain on the blood track until the final scoring.
4. Targets have recovered
If all the Targets Cards have the Angry face visible: turn them so that the Blood face is visible, keep the last 4 event cards and shuffle all the others face-down to form a new deck. In any case turn all Event Cards on the table face-down.

End of the game:
The game ends when all players have no Mosquito tokens to play.
The player with the largest amount of blood is the winner.

Single Player Mode and Cooperative Mode available.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: San-Antonio: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
San-Antonio Le jeu the game about San Antonio

Detective Superintendent Antoine San-Antonio is a kind of French James Bond with a "personal" slang rather than gadgets.

Progress along the board answering language questions.

boardgame.name: Pungeon Quest: A Pun-Packed Land of Eem Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pungeon Quest is a system-neutral, one-shot adventure designed to be used with any roleplaying game, and dropped into any campaign.

Pit your adventuring party against the dastardly Punderlord, a madcap master of puns who delights in cruel and unusual punishment! Encounter the likes of the fowl poltergeese, the deathly hilarious cackletrice, the foppish wearwolf who's late for a costume party, or the poor bastard sword who's just looking for his father.

boardgame.name: Land of Eem Fantasy RPG Quickstart Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Land of Eem RPG is coming to Kickstarter, full of new and gorgeous art, and sleek layout design. Here's what to expect...

THE GAME
A lighthearted fantasy adventure game in an easy to use, easy to learn core rulebook (available in PDF or Print format). Packed with rules and resources that make GMing easy and let players be creative.

THE SANDBOX
An extensive campaign sandbox setting filled with hundreds of locations, NPCs, quest hooks, random encounters, and rumors for players to pursue.

You can download the beta rulebooks right now for free and join our discord to talk about the game, share feedback, and find groups to play with.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: ASL Comp: Invasion Palestine! Sinai-Negev-Galilee
boardgame.description:
This is the Invasion Palestine! expansion for owners of GENESIS 3 and MAGACH 73.
Also needed are ASL RB, and Nationalities, including Russians.

Scenarios:

Sons of Galilee – Deganiaa, Israel, May 20th 1948
Etziongrad – Kfar Etzion, Palestine Mandate, May 13th 1948
Fatih-Allah – Mishmar Hayarden, June 10th 1948
I Dream of Jenin – Jenin, June 3rd 1948
The Whiskey Wager – Haifa, April 21st 1948
Death to the Invaders – Near Hill 113 and Kawkba, The Negev, July 18th 1948
Molotov Inferno – Semach, Syria, May 20th 1948
Level the Villages – Kibbutz Mishmar Haemek, Palestine Mandate, April 9th 1948
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ASL Comp: Genesis III – Arab-Israeli War 1948-67
ASL Comp: Magach 73 – The Yom Kippur War of 1973

boardgame.name: City of Winter
boardgame.description:
City of Winter gives us elegant rules, evocative prompts, and inspiring images to help us create a story as we play to explore characters in a world of our shared imagination. It is infinitely repayable and no two games will ever be the same. Like many Story Games, City of Winter does not need a game master or require any other materials or special preparation to play. Everything you need is in the box!

In City of Winter we tell a story that spans generations where the decisions we make as players define how our family changes over time. Over sessions of play our characters will grow old and pass into memory as new generations are born.

Play centers around the exploration of tradition. As we journey through the world of City of Winter, we will encounter varied traditions of the City represented by decks of Tradition Cards. As our characters change and grow the traditions they hold as a family change as well.

City of Winter takes place in a world of fantasy where things are possible that are not possible in our day to day lives. Use this space to imagine and discover without the restrictions we find in our day to day lives."

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

boardgame.name: 라온 주사위 (Raon Dice)
boardgame.description:
라온 주사위 (Raon Dice) is a game of rolling dice and making words by using vowels and consonants from the dice roll. In the process of combining the vowels and comparing the results, you can easily become familiar with Hangul (한글) while having fun.

라온 주사위 comes with four different ways to play using the components in the box.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: New York Yankees Collectors Edition
boardgame.description:
Mr. Monopoly hits one out of the ballpark in the Yankees Collector's edition of the Monopoly Game. With 39 American League Pennants and 26 World Series Trophies under their belt, a record in both cases, the Yankees set the bar for every other ball club in Major League Baseball.

In this completely customized MONOPOLY game, fans of the Bronx Bombers can buy, sell and trade all-star Yankees players like Derek Jeter, Mariano Rivera and Alex Rodriguez - as well as some of the newer Yankees players like Robinson Cano and clean cut Johnny Damon. Includes six collectible pewter tokens: Yankees cap, batter, pitcher, ball in glove, World Series trophy and catcher’s mask.

boardgame.name: 라온 더하기 (Raon Plus)
boardgame.description:
라온 더하기 (Raon Plus) is a game of making the best use out of transparent cards with Hangul (한글) alphabet or special characters to make words. Combine the alphabets in various ways and freely express your imagination.

라온 더하기 comes with three different ways to play with the components in the box.

listing.notes: Not for the game listed but for the game shown in this youtube video: https://youtu.be/2yfH0XIGTQU

boardgame.name: Land of Eem Fantasy RPG Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Land of Eem is a tabletop, fantasy roleplaying game about adventurers exploring and discovering the remnants of a forgotten, better age. Players take on the roles of lore-seeking travelers, fortune-seeking pioneers, and adventure-seeking heroes in a time devoid of them. The game is designed to value creativity, roleplaying, and exploration, over excessive combat. While getting into fights is still a part of the game, players are almost always given the opportunity to talk their way out of conflict. This is because almost every creature or “monster” you encounter in the Land of Eem is a person. They can speak a language, they have thoughts and feelings, desires and motivations; and you should be willing to parley before running headlong into a slugfest. True, some creatures may ultimately be selfish, ruthless, evil, or more difficult to talk to, but it would be wrong to assume that every
manticore wants to eat you, just as it would be foolish to think every human you meet wants to kill you.

From Inside of Book

boardgame.name: Dino Diner
boardgame.description:
It’s survival of the fattest in a pre-historic race to invent the restaurant! But this quest for fryers is fraught with danger! The more you cook for hungry customers, the more attention you draw from ravenous dinosaurs whose monstrous appetites can only be sated by one of three things – your dwindling food supplies, your customers, or you!

Primarily a set collection game with push-your-luck elements and heaping portion of player interaction, Dino Diner combines strategy and angst into a light meal of a game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Are My Wings Even?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Even faeries were young once. They don’t talk much about the immortals before they become ancient, before their beauty grows fractal depth beneath the unchanging surface of their skin. But even immortals are first children, uneven and unrefined. They are kept away from the courts and away from mortals as they shift and grow, change not just their appearance but their nature. Only adults have one true name. When you are young you don’t know who you are. Someday you will be refined to a point, into a blade that cuts through time. Uncertainty isn’t something you’ve had much chance to witness or learn, but still you feel it brewing inside you along with all the desires, fears, obsessions, the things that will eventually winnow down into your name. There are so many things you cannot say. You are bound by truth and you do not yet know what the truth is. When you are young there are a hundred trembling possibilities inside you, waiting to burst forth and be chosen. You have a hundred names.

boardgame.name: 电心 Diàn Xīn Electric Heart
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Diàn Xīn (电心) Electric Heart is a Cyberpunk TTRPG about trying to survive in a world that doesn't want you to thrive, without losing your sense of self worth or your will to keep going.

It explores Cyberpunk through a Chinese diaspora lens. However, it is not a game specifically about being Chinese diaspora and you do not have to be Chinese diaspora to play this game.
boardgame.rpg: 电心 Diàn Xīn Electric Heart

boardgame.name: Extra•Causal
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is Extracausal; a role-playing game about creating and uncovering a dense web of the paranatural, the occult, conspiracies, and of things far beyond it all. This is a game of encountering that which is extracausal. Imagine the Magnus Institute, the Federal Bureau of Control, Southern Reach. All groups that are involved with forces far greater than they could ever imagine, filled with individuals who piece together clues and secrets in the hopes of knowing the unknowable.

boardgame.name: Torment
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Doomed

You‘re fucked. No matter how you look at it, time will run out, and eventually, you are all going to die.

boardgame.name: Wahh! Babies & Big Kids
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a baby. Inasmuch as you have agency, you have certain goals...The Gamemaster will...inspire your adventure.

boardgame.name: Family Feud Blockbuster Movie Edition
boardgame.description:
FAST-PACED FUN: Family Feud Blockbuster Game is an exciting, fast-paced game for everyone 12+. Teams take turns trying to guess the most popular answers to 200 survey questions about film!
MOVIES, MOVIES AND MORE MOVIES: Can you name a former TV star who became an A-lister? How about naming a movie with a made-up language? Brush up on your movie smarts because there are hundreds of survey questions waiting for your answers.
PLAY FACE OFF AND FAST MONEY ROUNDS: Just like on the show, you’ll compete in two categories. Play three Face Off rounds before you try the Fast Money round where everything can change with a simple answer!
QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Just take the game out of the box, set up the components, choose your teams and get ready to play! For 3 or more players, ages 12 and up.
Includes: 150 Face Off Cards, 50 Fast Money Cards, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, Instructions

boardgame.name: Flip'M
boardgame.description:
The game comes in a cup. The object to be flipped is M-shaped when stood upright. Players press on the 'valley' of the M using the tip of the finger and the piece will shoot upwards.

The objective of the game is to score the highest number of points in seven shots. Two points for flipping the piece into the cup and one point for hooking it on the edge.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Monopoly: New York City Edition
boardgame.description: Interested in beating Donald Trump at his own game? With this New York City version of classic Monopoly, the most prized real estate in the Big Apple is available, and at bargain rates. The Brooklyn Bridge has never been so cheap--$100 for the whole thing--and for only $60, take Staten Island as well. Comes with eight unique pewter tokens, including a top hat and a racing car, as well as the usual stacks of money, dice, and Chance cards. Take a whirl around the board, land on Times Square or Broadway, then see if you can pick up a penthouse on Central Park East for a song.

listing.notes:
Has wears on the box, but the content is clean.
BG181226B

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Disney Villains Collectors Edition
boardgame.description:
Monopoly; Disney Villains Edition Game lets you relive the excitement of all your favorite Disney villains -- from Chernabos to Ursula -- with this very special edition of the classic Monopoly; board game. Magic Mirror and Cauldron cards might make your dreams come true or they might bring an unexpected trip to jail. Use your Wishes wisely to collect the deeds to Disney Villains belongings; increase their value on your way to victory!

The game board is different from Monopoly: My Disney Villains.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Orlando Edition
boardgame.description: Monopoly with a Orlando, Florida theme.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Care Bears
boardgame.description: Have a rainbow day! Catch some fun as you buy, sell, and trade the Care Bears and their Cousins in MONOPOLY®: Care Bears edition. With each roll of the dice, pick up a beloved friend like Wish Bear, Funshine Bear, or Grumpy Bear, then use Star Buddies to add Hearts and Cloud Castles to your properties. Choose your favorite token like the Hot Air Balloon, Cloud Car or the Rainbow Roller as you travel through Care-a-lot picking up friends. Every day is special when you let the fun shine in.

boardgame.name: Fields of Fire: The Bulge Campaign
boardgame.description:
The 9th Infantry Regiment “Manchus,” 2nd Infantry Division faced three weeks of intense combat from December 13th, 1944 to January 8th, 1945 as part of the Battle of the Bulge. This campaign covers those critical days. The Campaign consists of seven new missions featuring a new Terrain Deck for the forests, fields, and villages of the Ardennes. The counter sheet includes a U.S. heavy machine gun platoon, Bangalore torpedoes, anti-tank mines, wire entanglements, German tanks, assault guns, Panzergrenadiers, and Volksgrenadiers.

We left the “Manchus” of World War Two in Fields of Fire: Volume I at the close of the Normandy Campaign. The 2nd Infantry Division was rapidly moved to join the assault on the port city of Brest, in Brittany. The city was captured after heavy fighting from August 21st to September 18th. By that time, the German resistance elsewhere in France had collapsed, and the 2nd Infantry Division raced to Paris, arriving on September 29th. The rapid advance ended on October 4th when the Division entered the region just east of St. Vith, Belgium called the Schnee Eifel on the highly symbolic German border. The 2nd Infantry Division relieved the 4th and 28th Infantry Divisions, completing the relief on October 5th. Ahead lay the German border, defended by the Siegfried Line cutting across difficult terrain.

The “Manchus” were able to incorporate replacements and prepare for whatever would come next throughout October and November. This period saw frequent patrol activity but no major combat actions. On December 10th, the 2nd Infantry Division began a relief in place by the 106th Infantry Division. By the 11th, the relief was complete, and the Division gathered at Camp Elsenborn to prepare for the renewed offensive. The attack north through the Siegfried line would commence on December 13th.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Twin Play Classics: Clue and Sorry
boardgame.description:
Two of the world's favorite family games, Clue and Sorry, in an beautiful boxed set.

These board games were a combination of two popular classic games contained in a premium wooden box, with the idea that they would grace a coffee table. The boards of each paired game were on each other's flip side. The case came with a brass plate and was sometimes called The Collector's Edition. It was marketed as a game that would "a great gift" or "part of your family's collection".
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: Garbage Gatherers
boardgame.description:
The amount of space garbage is growing and the Earth Government has decided that this is the moment to do something. And your mech company has been selected to do the job! Take your flies and your hulk mechs to gather the garbage, extract the valuable resources and mine more bytecoins than your opponents!

On you turn, you will select one of your mech to move. If you select a Fly mech, you can go around the factories to gather some garbage or you can cross over the factories to drop the garbage previously gathered.

If there is enough garbage on a factory, it will be automatically transformed into bytecoins. Don't miss the chance to move the Spider mech to try to gather those valuable bytecoins!

The other option on your turn is to move a Hulk mech. These mech also gather those valuable bytecoins from the factories, but even more important, they won't let other Fry mech pass!

The first player who get the target amount of bytecoins will be the best Garbage Gatherer, and thus, will win the game!

—description from the designer

Expansion Nr. 4 for DiceWars. This new expansion introduce new movement and battle formation abilities. The new faction, "Knights of Steel", has a special dangerous defense.

boardgame.name: Live On
boardgame.description:
In Live On you take on the role of a survivor and try to escape the onslaught of zombies. Find weapons, use your skills, try to survive alone or in a team.

In 4 different types of missions, each with 3 different map sizes, you have to try to meet the mission requirements and escape alive.
You also have the opportunity to design your own map and create your own missions.

How many zombies you have to fight against is decided by your luck when you roll the dice. Is it 2 or is it 10?
But not only the zombies are your opponents, you can also decide to play against each other.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lord Sombrio's Horse Lottery
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A business-card sized table to enrich your horse acquisition experience in Mork Borg!

boardgame.name: Codex Occultum
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In the game, you and your friends are fixers, people who get together to work as a company solving problems of other people who hire you to do so. The setting is a slightly different 18th century, with different perspectives over mysticism, afterall you are playing during the birth of the enlightenment era. The game have a few gems to make it different from any other TTRPG you have played: The system of Rituals, the Secret Society mechanics, and the Classes available to be played.

Choose between a Vampire, a Combatant, a Professional, a Scholar or a Sin Eater to live and adventure in the Rat District, and try finding out what is the Palm of Kali!

boardgame.name: Battlestreets
boardgame.description:
From the description:

BATTLESTREETS is a tabletop rpg that lives in the spirit of those old side-scrolling arcade fighting games-- where a few lowly yet fantastically talented fighters took their battle to the streets, saving their neighborhood and stopping the forces of evil.

Welcome to The City-- a dystopian world-megapolis just sideways and slightly ahead of our own time, in the grip of Doom from villains of industry, crime, and selfish power.

Players take the roles of young people touched by Destiny. It has "marked" them, empowering them to become champions. But the agents of Doom will not go quietly. You can win by telling stories of your characters overcoming threats, fulfilling their calling, and becoming true heroes!

This a storytelling game where all the Players take the role of heroes fighting
villains. Everyone builds the story of the Destiny and Doom that lay before
them, contributing to the choice of objectives, the shape the map area, and
the narration of fight scenes. This can happen with, or in lieu of, one Player
taking the role of Destiny (or Gamemaster.)

It's also a resource-spending game where Players roll some dice to see how
effective their actions shape their world. This means sometimes choosing
between spending "Power" or building it up in reserve for various effects.

A successful game comes from embracing the collaborative and open-ended
nature of the game setting. Characters are heroic-- young people discovering
their power and making a new place in an old world. Fantastic powers are
likely and even expected, so don't be afraid of narrative description. Skills and
traits are focused on combat, but also one's reputation and Calling, and lots of
room for imagination and improvisation.

BATTLE FOR THE STREETS. FIGHT FOR YOUR DESTINY!

boardgame.name: Colorbot
boardgame.description:
The life is sad in Robotcity. Hopefully you will be able to change that. On kid advice, the robots decide replace their dark fuel by color paint.

Colorbot is a print and play where player will color the bot they have in their laboratory (sheet).
Each turn will will pick two markers, then use the first one and the second one. Having fuel block filled :

of only one color will bring you 3 points and the robot will gain an eye (draw it)
of three different colors 2 points and an antenna


(If you have only two colors...0 points).
When two of your 3 robots are power-on, the game ends.

An other laboratory (sheet) is provided with advanced rules (more ways to score).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Asunder: The Keeper's Tome
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Asunder is a primal world with no metal, abandoned by its gods, and plagued with warring factions and dark mysteries. This world is also dying. Some have seen the signs and are seeking answers or maybe a last grab for power before it’s over. They are Seekers.

However, amid the savagery and despair, there is great beauty and wonder in this world. Humans have shaped plants into machines and bonded with beasts and even the mighty ocean. It is a place that holds no parallel. There are Lost civilizations, monsters the size of hills, and plants that feast on humans. And then, of course, there is chaos. A force only meant for gods, but in the hands of mortals creates terrifying havoc, but its power is an addiction few can break.

And you, you will be the Keeper of this worlds’ secrets. You will share them with your Seekers as you lead them on an impossible journey into the frightening unknown. It is a holy and terrifying calling, but one full of rich reward.

You hold in your hands the Keeper’s Tome for Asunder, a resource that contains the secrets, political intrigue, cultural depth, and monster creation needed to be a captivating storyteller. Asunder is a game of people seeking answers to a dying world. Though their motives are seldom pure, one thing is sure: struggle, intrigue, and mystery await them.

boardgame.name: Asunder: Seeker's Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is broken, broken long ago by the Gods who made us—broken when they fled to fight their eons-long war and took with them all the metal of the land. And their children, they left behind in a world that cares for them not at all. A world savage, beautiful and wondrous all at once.

But the people adapted to what was left. When the gods created humans, they invested in them a fragment of their own Essence, and it bonded with the world around them, allowing them to command animals and plants and reshape their bodies. With no metal, they crafted other substances and made symbiotic lifeforms to act as weapons, armor, and tools. And a few found shards of Chaos. The power the Gods used to create, but in human hands, it causes much havoc.

There are many mysteries in the World of Asunder. Some are just beneath the surface of the land, and some have caused the dead to rise, consuming all in their path. Where are demons birthed? What do the Naga want? Is the world truly coming to an end? Is Gaia the mother of the planet, or simply devouring the humans in it? To find answers, some form bands of Seekers: powerful, adventurous individuals, outcasts in search of more. Their story is your story.

You hold the Seeker’s Guide for Asunder in your hands, a resource that contains all the rules you need to be a Seeker, as well as many your Keeper needs to run the game. Asunder is a game of people seeking truth, power, and belonging in a savage world without metal or Gods.

boardgame.name: The Seed of Gaia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Seed of Gaia" is an Asunder campaign module that contains three adventures taking characters from level 0 to 2. The adventure begins at the scene of a grisly murder and takes players through a treacherous web of betrayal. Seekers will find themselves crime-solving in a hamlet on the Mainland, tomb-raiding in the Necropolis of Sky City, and facing Gaia at the cursed Wellspring of New Gaia.

boardgame.name: The Compendium of Equestria
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Compendium of Equestria; a must-have for GMs and players wanting to include the latest and greatest Tails of Equestria content as well as brand new creatures, characters, adventures, and items!

GMs can use both the Locations and GM’s Toolkit sections to help fill their Tails of Equestria games with deep and interesting settings, and plenty of new features including talents and magical treasure.

Players will find new playable races, expanding the options presented in the Core Rulebook, The Bestiary of Equestria and the Movie Sourcebook. Together, you will find some great new spells and talents to use in your adventures.

Finally, you’ll find a fully self-contained adventure: "Flim, Flam, Alakazam!" This can be used as a standalone story, or as part of a longer campaign, and it’s a great opportunity to make use of the new content presented in the rest of the Compendium!
boardgame.rpghonor: 2021 UK Games Expo Best Role-playing Expansion Judges Award Winner
boardgame.rpg: My Little Pony: Tails of Equestria

boardgame.name: Artifices, Deceptions and Dilemmas
Artifices, Deceptions, & Dilemmas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are already a great Dungeon Master. You run a game really well.

What's the difference between a room and a chamber? What's the difference between a mausoleum, a sepulcher, and a crypt? Would disarming traps be more exciting if you understood how those complex mechanisms worked? What does a magic trap look like? What does a solar room look like and what's usually inside?

What's in it?

Over 100 Illustrations of Lavish environments Guidelines for escalating threats while respecting player agency Hundreds of ideas for tricks and traps.

No longer will your players complain about traps or unfair encounters. Now when they meet their doom, they will blame themselves for their own foolishness! Be as cruel and devious as you want with these guidelines on how to do so fairly!

Looking for something to spice up an encounter? Pick one of hundreds of options of traps, rooms, walls, tricks or more! Fill rooms with ease, design encounters in ways that give your players the freedom to put their own characters in hot water!

What's it for?

Referees who run games and understand their role in facilitating the groups adventure. This book provides guidance on how to create encounters that respect players and allow you to make encounters as exciting and dangerous as you want, without fear of being unfair. Imagine a group excited to discover a trap. Fill in your gaps of knowledge raising your confidence and making you a master ready to lead players on an adventure.

These objective procedures give referees tools that fire a desire in players to dive into your creative world, discover its detailed history, and make their mark on it. Artifices, Deceptions, and Dilemmas gives you the tools to eliminate doubt and provides a library of ideas that will take you decades to exhaust. It will be a vade mecum, at hand for every environment and dungeon you create. Design a dangerous dungeon, concoct an ingenious trap, develop a diabolical arena, all with confidence and without concern. Give yourself the power, all with simple and clear guidelines!

This is a book used in every game you run. Your next campaign, the one after that, the one after that. . . Not one wasted word. Every page is crammed with content and creativity. No filler. Tools that describe devilish traps and devious decoys. Explore your own Artifices, Deceptions, and Dilemmas today!

boardgame.name: Exploration Trail
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thane Dunston needs a hearty group of adventurers to plot his lands which include frontier areas. Little do the party realize that this simple task pits them against a few adversaries including an Elemental Wizard!

This adventure is a sandbox setting although set in the interior of Dilad. This scenario is made under 5thedition rules but is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

boardgame.name: Libram of Lost Spells, Volume 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Libram of Lost Spells takes you on a trip through time to reach back to older editions of the 'World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game' and enjoy some of the greatest spells of those days of yore, forgotten to the current game's 5th edition.

We've recreated these spells with great care, bringing them to life again for the 5th edition of the game. Each volume presents 20 "new" spells that you may recognize with great fondness.

Enjoy the nostolgia of these great spells once more or just interject some surprises of new spells into your games today!
